title: 103_hr3810
content: The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to include acquisition of lands, easements, and rights-of-ways necessary for construction of treatment works. It also expands eligibility for assistance to provide wastewater treatment and water supply services to communities. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to include encouraging the use of innovative and cost-effective technologies in the construction of treatment works financed with assistance provided from the fund. The amendment to the Federal Water Pollution Control Act allows for loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, including interest-free and negative-interest loans, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the useful life of the project financed. The amendment allows for loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the useful life of the project financed. Additionally, a portion of loans will be used to make negative-interest loans to these communities. Planning grants to disadvantaged communities are also addressed in the amendment. The amendment allows for grants to rural and disadvantaged communities to cover up to 75 percent of planning and predevelopment costs for construction or improvement of treatment works. The grants are limited to 1-2 percent of Federal grant awards to the water pollution control revolving fund in a fiscal year, with a maximum grant amount of $75,000 per project. The amendment allows grants to rural and disadvantaged communities for planning and predevelopment costs for treatment works, limited to 1-2% of Federal grant awards in a fiscal year, with a maximum of $75,000 per project. Definitions for "rural and disadvantaged communities" exclude areas with a population over 10,000 and residents with a household income above 75% of the national median. The term 'negative-interest loan' refers to a loan with zero percent interest rate provided by a State to rural and disadvantaged communities, with a forgiveness of up to 2 percent of the principal per year, not exceeding 20 percent over the loan term. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS amended to limit costs to 4 percent of total funds deposited into the fund. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE introduces a grant program under Title VI of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The Administrator may provide grants to organizations for training and technical assistance to rural communities on treatment works. $15,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized for fiscal years 1994 through 1998. A conforming amendment is made to Section 607 of the Act.
